result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricky L. Dortch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ricky L. Dortch in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  States advises matter is resolved.  Attorney Martinez gives sentencing joint recommendation.  Plea to Count 1 & 2.   Oral amendment from Count 5 to Count 2.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
12 months Probation
Submit to DNA sample, unless previously provided.
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
$268.00 costs and $250.00 DNA surcharge & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)

Count 2:
2 days Sauk County Jail, 2 days credit.  TIME SERVED.
$243.00 costs and $200.00 DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay or payment plan with Clerk of Court's office.  

14TR5370-reopened, vacated and dismissed
14TR5360- Plea of guilty; court imposes: $811.50 forfeiture, AODA, 6 month revocation. NO IID requirement.
14TR5359-Dismissed.
Paperwork handed in court.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-02-2015 01:00 pm

Attorney Andrew I. Martinez in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reset, DE is on way but going to be 2 hours yet.  State will be here but Atty. Martinez will not.    Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant but stayed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-23-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Ricky L. Dortch in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter reset due to probation intake availability.  Attorney Martinez gives new date and time for sentencing.  Matter reset. Bond continues.

Defendant Ricky L. Dortch in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Martinez acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court advises DE of charges/maximum penalties.  Bond continued and TR matters to track.
Arraignment on March 3, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment on January 27, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Ricky L. Dortch in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State ready to proceed.  State calls Trooper Manke, sworn & testifies.  WI State Patrol.  Testifies as to incident in question.  Attorney Martinez cross examines.    Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.  Set for ARGN date.  Bond continues.  Arraignment scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on January 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Ricky L. Dortch in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to dismiss.  Defendant was passenger of vehicle.  Challenging the complaint, not given the complete elements of offense.  State has not filed an amended complaint.  Facts alleged don't comply with the statute.  Atty. Albrecht makes argument sites State v. Harris 206wis2nd242, jury instruction JI2630.  Atty. Martinez redirect.  Court states here on motion for sufficiency of the complaint - Court is satisfied that the complaint is filed correctly.  Deny motion to dismiss.  Set for furth proceedings.  Bond continues.

Defendant Ricky L. Dortch by video from LEC with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Defendant Ricky L. Dortch in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Gumz responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $500.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times, not to operate MV w/o valid DL and if operating he must submit to breath test if requested to do so by law enforcement.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
